alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:23PM CDT until July 21 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT/1045 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO AND SOUTHWESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 923 PM MDT/1023 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bonny Reservoir and Hale. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 209 and 210, and between mile markers 212 and 218. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
